That's a great plan! Taking a 10-minute walk during your lunch break, doing jumping jacks during commercial breaks, and taking the stairs instead of the elevator are all excellent ways to increase your physical activity levels. Remember, every bit counts, and these small changes can add up to make a big difference in your overall health and fitness.

Wearing your Fitbit Charge 3 every day will help you track your progress and stay motivated. Make sure to sync it regularly and check your progress on the Fitbit app. You can also set reminders on your Fitbit to move throughout the day, which can be a great way to stay on track.

And don't forget to clean your hearing aids tomorrow morning! It's great that you're taking care of your hearing health.

Remember to be kind to yourself and don't get discouraged if you miss a day or two. Just get back on track and keep moving forward. You got this!

Here's a recap of your plan:

* Take a 10-minute walk during your lunch break at work
* Do a few jumping jacks during commercial breaks while watching TV
* Take the stairs instead of the elevator at work
* Wear your Fitbit Charge 3 every day to track your progress
* Clean your hearing aids tomorrow morning

You're taking small but significant steps towards a healthier and more active lifestyle. Keep up the good work!
